# Day 17 2024

What a challenge this was!  First I discovered the 3-bit instruction to bits of numbers that passed through gates.  I build a BFS searcher but made the mistake to start building my number at the first instruction.  Going from 2-4-...0 There are many options that can get you to the next number.  Finally I rebuilt the searcher and reversed the way I was looking and started at 0 and built the number by << 3 each round.  This started with 1 possibilities and at most only had a few branches to check on the way back.

In the end there were 6 possible starting points for my problem set.

**164541160582845, 164541160583101, 164545589767869, 164545589768125, 164546529291965, 164546529292221**

### Looking for number associations for numbers that make it through gates
22 (10110), 30 (11110), 34 (100010), 38 (100110), 46 (101110), 53 (110101)

### Here I start to notice a 3 bit patter emerge
76 (1001100), 78 (1001110), 79 (1001111), 588 (1001001100), 591 (1001001111) 

12 1100 

844 1101001 1 00 3773 111011001 1 01 3901 111100110 1 01 7869 1111010111 1 01

101 001 101 101 011 001 101 001 001 100 100 111 001 001 111 100
<br/>
    000                          000
<br/>
2,  4,  1,  1,  7,  5,  1,  5,  4,  0,  0,  3,  5,  5,  3,  0

110 000 100 100 011 001 100 001 000 100 100 111 001 001 111 100

110 000 100 100 011 001 100 001 000 100 100 111 001 001 111 100

117440

[0,  3,  5,  4,  3,  0]

 7   1   0   7   4   4

011 100 101 011 000 000

### I have made it to gate 5 brute forcing my way from start to finish of the program

```

#### Here the answer was inserted after the fact to compare how i was progressing and it would appear given years of computation I could have made it to the last instruction

### Then I made the unfortunate discovery the Hex digits lined up on many of the positive sections

I lost a lot of time running the program using 4 bit values
```
